title-group.article-title: The Renegotiation of the 1982 Gas Contract between France and the USSR

abstract.p: The gas contract signed on January 18, 1982, between France and the USSR followed those of 1972 and 1974; it contains a revision clause which France applied in 1985 when the initial parameters had changed: namely, the price of other European gas contracts, competitive energy prices on the French market, and gas consumption lower than projected levels. On June 6, 1985, an agreement was signed between GDF [Gaz de France] and Soyuzgazexport [the Soviet gas export company] which projected a slower rise than forecast (1986 purchases decreased by half), and a 7% fall in prices as a result of a new indexing formula. The 1972 and 1974 contracts also benefited from this revision: a total saving of 900 million francs in 1985 for GDF.
